data.title: 10 Living Legacies – Independent Newspaper Nigeria
data.meta_description: Independent.ng - Nigeria News - Top Nigerian newspapers - Breaking news - Top news headlines from Nigeria and World.
data.text:
Legacies are the future. Unlike many other industries where history and people of the past stay in the past, Nollywood is an industry with a long memory. This is not just because their memories and pasts are well documented through their films and works, it is because of the children that they leave behind to carry on their good works. Here is a list of our top ten Nollywood legacies.

The Afolayans

Birthed by the late actor, filmmaker, producer, director, and dramatist, Adeyemi Josiah Afolayan, popularly called ‘Ade Love’, this family of legacies have since been a gift to the industry and are prize jewels in Nollywood. Asides their claim to a throne in the industry, they also have an aunt, Toyin Afolayan who was the sister to the late Ade Love. In his lifetime, he produced notable works like ‘Ajani Ogun’ (1976) and ‘Taxi Driver’ (1983). The Afolayans in the film industry include Kunle, Moji, Gabriel and Aremu Afolayan.

Kunle Afolayan

Perhaps one of the most successful and talked about of the Afolayan scions, Kunle Afolayan earned his coveted space among the ‘reputables’ of the industry not just with his father’s name, but by the giant strides and almost impossible pace he set as a filmmaker.

He came to limelight in Tunde Kelani’s 1999 movie, Saworoide, where he played the role of Adebola. While he majored in Economics and started out working in a bank while doing some casual acting, he ventured into full-time filmmaking when he embarked on a course at the New York Film Academy. Since 2005, he has been active in the Nigerian film industry.

Some of his more popular works include: ‘The Figurine: Araromire’, which was in the Yoruba and English languages and ‘Phone Swap’. He is married with three children.

Gabriel Afolayan

Recently espoused in a star-studded, superlative wedding, Gabriel Afolayan, also known by his musical stage name G-Fresh, is a Nigerian actor and singer. After studying Theater Arts at the University of Ibadan, he went on to take his place as an actor in the Nigerian film industry. The award-winning actor made limelight when he won the Best Supporting Actor award for playing Tavier Jambari in the 2012 movie, ‘Hoodrush’. As a musician, he is known mostly for ‘Awelewa’ and ‘Kokoro Ife’.

Some of his other film appearances include ‘Ojuju’, ‘Madam Dearest’, and ‘Okafor’s Law’.

Moji Afolayan

Certainly no small achiever, beautiful Moji Afolayan is not just a legacy, but also the first daughter of the late Ade Love. She has held sway in the Yoruba arm of the Nigerian film industry, and is married to popular Nigerian actor Rasaq Olayiwola, stage named ‘Ojopagogo’, Moji is a Nigerian actress, film-maker, producer and director.

A teacher by training, Moji is a thespian by blood. Some of her works include Arinjo and Jagun Aso.

Aremu Afolayan

Aremu Afolayan is another member of the Afolayan family. He is a Nigerian film actor and maker. He is mostly known for his 2009 film, ‘Idamu Akoto’.

Asides this, the controversial actor is married with a child.

The Kosokos

Hailing from Lagos, the Kosoko film family are a force to reckon with due to their father’s decades of investments in the industry. Prince Jide Kosoko is a living veteran whose exploits and contributions to the industry as an actor, and filmmaker over the years is almost the stuff of legends.

Sola Kosoko Abina

Sola Kosoko is a Nigerian actress and daughter of Prince Jide Kosoko. Asides appearing both on stage and screen over the years, she is one of the successful Nigerian actresses who have grown with the industry.

She came into prominence with her father’s movie, ‘Omo Olorire’ in 2001. A graduate of Olabisi Onabanjo University, she obtained a Diploma in Performing Arts at the same university and was sponsored by the Federal Government alongside her dad, and few others actors. Some of her movie productions are ‘Sindara’, ‘Wosi Kenke’ and ‘Ese ni’. She is married to Abiodun Abina with children

Bidemi Kosoko

Bidemi Kosoko is the younger of the Kosoko girls, who is a graduate of Theatre Arts from the Lagos State University. Aside other awards, she was at a time nominated for the Future Awards Africa Nigeria Prize for Acting. A true heir to her father’s acting legacy, the dimpled and delectable Bidemi has acted in quite a number of movies, both in the English and Yoruba speaking arm of Nollywood.

The Adebayos

Led by the legendary Adebayo Salami popularly known as Oga Bello, the Adebayos in the film industry are more than the two listed here, but this two have left indelible marks in the industry.

Femi Adebayo

Femi Adebayo is a Nigerian lawyer, film actor, director, producer and Special Adviser to the Governor of Kwara State on Arts, Culture and Tourism. He is the son of the veteran actor, Adebayo Salami. A graduate of the University of Ilorin, where he obtained a bachelor’s degree in Law (LLB and LLM) and a Master of Arts (M.A) degree in Theatre Art, he also studying for his Doctorate Degree (Ph.D) in Law at University of Ilorin.

He came into limelight in 1995 after he featured in a Tade Ogidan movie titled Owo Blow. Some of the award-winning actor’s works include ‘Sonto Alapata’, ‘Wura Ati Fadaka’, ‘Ma Wobadan’ ‘Survival Of Jelili’, ‘October 1’, ‘Ayitale’ and ‘Buga’

Temitope Adebayo

Born June 28, Temitiope Adebayo is a 2006 graduate of the University of Ilorin who holds a degree in Computer Engineering. Asides other roles in diverse movies, he is known for his comic role as Waheed ‘Weda’, Suliat’s brother, in Jenifa’s Diary.

Yul Edochie

Yul Edochie is a Nigerian actor and son of the grandmaster of acting, Pete Edochie. He holds a Bachelor of Arts in Dramatic Arts from the University of Port Harcourt.

He got his break in 2007 after featuring alongside Genevieve Nnaji and Desmond Elliot in the movie ‘Wind Of Glory’.

Presently, Yul runs the Yul Edochie Academy. Asides that, he has announced intentions to run for Governor of Anambra State. He has several awards under his belt and is an actor of renown.

Sunkanmi Omobolanle

Sunkanmi Omobolanle is the son of Sunday ‘Aluwe’ Omobolanle, popularly known as ‘Papi Luwe’ and Peju Ogunmola. Sunkanmi s a Nigerian film actor and director.

A Business Administration graduate, some of his film appearances include; ‘Olaide Irawo’, and ‘Gongo Aso’.
